name: overcapacity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A situation in which an industry or a factory is producing more than it can sell: A recent surge in steel consumption has reduced global overcapacity in the steel industry. The merger will reduce overcapacity, cut costs, and increase efficiency. The company's annual results have been seriously affected by over-capacity.
the state of being more or greater in amount than what can be contained: Most maternity units are working at overcapacity. The screaming, over-capacity crowd was jammed into the venue.
More examplesFewer examplesCotton manufacturers began to suffer from overcapacity in the 1950s. Because of overcapacity, all the other employees were made redundant. Observers estimate that the industry still has more than 30% over-capacity.

ECONOMICS, PRODUCTION a situation in which companies in an industry can make and supply more products than customers buy or are expected to buy: He blamed the profit collapse on overcapacity which led to the excessive discounting of holiday packages. Compare
spare capacity
undercapacity
